meanings.definition: The act of criticizing or pointing out faults or flaws in something.
meanings.sent1: Her constant faultfinding made it hard to enjoy the movie.
meanings.sent2: His faultfinding at work often led to tension among his colleagues.
meanings.sent3: The faultfinding of the picky eater at the restaurant was comical.
meanings.sent4: The faultfinding of the detective helped uncover the hidden clues.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's faultfinding eye caught every mistake in the students' essays.

meanings.definition: Someone who habitually finds faults or flaws in others.
meanings.sent1: Being a faultfinding friend can strain relationships.
meanings.sent2: The faultfinding neighbor always had something negative to say.
meanings.sent3: The faultfinding aunt never missed a chance to criticize.
meanings.sent4: She saw herself as a faultfinding mirror, reflecting others' flaws.
meanings.sent5: The faultfinding boss never seemed satisfied with anyone's work.
